description: From mind +‎ -ed. Compare Old English -mōd (“minded”), Old English ġehyġd (“minded; disposed”).

adjectives.description: minded (comparative more minded, superlative most minded)

entries.meaning: (in combination, usually hyphenated) Having or exemplifying a mind of the stated type, nature or inclination.
Having a preference for doing something; having a likelihood, or disposition to carry out an act.
examples: I am minded to refuse the request.
Order another drink if you are so minded
He seems minded to go ahead with the plan.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of mind
